test_data_notes: Each tab includes the Promoting Interoperability measure.
Health IT developers are required to use the same patient names, date of birth, and sex included in the test data and may not use their own test names, date of birth, and sex.

Where CMS allows for providers to include or exclude certain data, health IT developers must demonstrate the ability to record the denominator  and numerator with or without the data (i.e. ePrescribing allows for the inclusion or exclusion of controlled substances).
Measures that are no longer included in the Promoting Interoperability programs will not be tested and therefore do not have test data.

If a Health IT Module performs a function automatically, such as making the patient education materials available electronically once identified, or automatically making data available to a patient via view, download, transmit, or an API, it is at the ATL's discretion not to test scenarios that assume this functionality is not automatic.

For Promoting Interoperability Measures, CMS clarified that a numerator is not constrained to an EHR reporting period when the EHR reporting period is less than one year.  The numerator action may reasonably fall outside the EHR reporting period timeframe but must take place no earlier than the start of the calendar year and no later than the end of the calendar year in order for the patients to be counted in the numerator.  As such, actions occurring after the end of the reporting period's calendar year will not count in the numerator.  For applicable measures, the test data has been built to verify that a Health IT Module can record the numerator correctly for each scenario.

Starting in 2019, a Promoting Interoperability Measure numerator and denominator is constrained to the performance period chosen, with the exception of the Security Risk Analysis measure which may occur any time during the calendar year.

test_links.summary: Required Test 2a - Patient Electronic Access (certified to (e)(1) and (g)(8) or (g)(9))
Required Test 2b - Patient Electronic Access (certified to (e)(1))
Required Test 2c - Patient Electronic Access (certified to (g)(8) or (g)(9))
Required Test 4a - View, Download, and Transmit (certified to (e)(1) and (g)(8) or (g)(9))
Required Test 4b - View, Download, and Transmit (certified to (e)(1))
Required Test 4c - View, Download, and Transmit (certified to (g)(8) or (g)(9))
Required Test 6 - Patient Generated Health Data
Required Test 15 - Electronic Referral Loops by Receiving and Incorporating Health Information

version_log.version_description: Reformatted data to account for testing indiviual EPs, individual ECs, and group ECs.  Made corrections to data, reorganized the required tests to follow the order of CMS measure numbers, modified test notes.
Removed note 5 from Required Test 2c.  Fixed test note in Required Test 5. Modified Required Tests 4a and 4c to allow for use of an API for the Modified Stage 2 and ACI Transition measures.
Updated test notes in Required Tests 2a, b, c; 3, 4a, b, c; 5; 6; 7; and 8.  Corrected data errors in Required Tests 1 and 2a. Modified test data in Required Tests 4a, 4b, and 4c.
Removed the requirement to calculate data for a TIN/NPI combination at a group TIN level.  Removed Scenario 2 from Required Tests 2a, 2b, 2c, and 3.
Updated General Notes.  Updated test data notes for Required Test 3 and 5.
Updated the ACI measure in RT 4a, 4b, and 4c to clarify that the action is taken by the patient or patient authorized representative rather than the Eligible Clinician.
Modified the timely access requirement for the ACI Patient Electronic Access measure in RT 2a, 2b, and 2c based on a CMS policy change per the QPP CY 2018 final rule (82 FR 53568).

Made the following changes based on CMS policy changes per the CY2019 PFS final rule: Updated the tab names for Required Test 2a, 2b, 2c, and 7 and added a test data note outlining the measure name change and that no other changes were made to the test data. Added a test data note to Required Test 7 noting that any document template within the C-CDA can be used to meet the measure. Modified the information on when actions must occur to populate the numerator for Promoting Interoperability measures starting in 2019.

Made the following changes based on CMS policy changes per the CY2019 PFS final rule: added Required Tests 13, 14, and 15.  Added general note 12 stating that testing for Required Tests 13 and 14 is self-declaration.  Added general note 13 noting Promoting Interoperability measures that are only applicable in 2018.  Added general note 14 noting Promoting Interoperability measures that are only applicable starting in 2019.  Added general note 15 noting that testing to the Modified Stage 2 and Promoting Interoperability Transition calculation methods is optional starting in 2019.

Updated general note 12 to remove RT 13. Modified general note 14 removing RT 13 and clarifying that RT 14 is only applicable in 2019.  Added general note 16 clarifying that RT 13 is no longer available for testing as it is now a Yes/No measure.

Based on the sunsetting of the 2014 Edition in the Cures Final rule measure descriptions have been updated to reflect 2020 Promoting Interoperability requirements. RT 14 was for 2019 only and has been removed
